bioghist.p: Peter Rees Joshua (b. 1893) was a Presbyterian minister. He attended seminary at Cardiff (Wales) Theological Seminary. From 1927 to 1940 he was pastor of Central Presbyterian Church in Huntington, Long Island, New York. He also served pastorates in Minnesota and California.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Peter Joshua. Materials include: Joshua's notebooks for sermons and Bible study; publications of Joshua's radio broadcasts, as well as three shellac audio discs; correspondence to Joshua (many letters from Carl F. H. Henry), form letters, and mass distributed photographs from the Republican Party; personal financial information, such as Social Security benefits; one page of a manuscript by Joshua titled "Confessions of an Aged Man's Thoughts" and some supporting materials; some printed materials containing articles by Joshua; books and printed materials, some with personal inscriptions; family photographs, many with identifications; and personal memorabilia, including pins and various Bibles. The collection also includes letters sent to Joshua's wife upon his death, a memorial book from his funeral, and a eulogy and clippings about Joshua.
